<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n5jgbhNXVj1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Planning out the task assignments and new UI features for the next batch of features for 0.24. Sketching out designs for the currency Ã¢â‚¬ËœgaugesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ right now. </span></p>

<p><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA): </strong><span>Almost done with the test environment of vBulletin 5.1 for the upgrade of the KSP Forums. Also, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on another project with Bob and Miguel that will be announced later, hopefully.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> I have kept on working on the animatic, in order to have a more clear schematic of how the characters are going to move. Since itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the first one that is going to be done collaboratively, the more information in there, the better. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s kind of an experiment in its own way. </span></p>

<p><strong>Jim (Romfarer)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Just finished up bugfixing and tweaking all the new gui stuff for 0.24. Getting ready to add more, contracts archives is up first.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps):</strong> </span><span>Contacted a bunch of cool people about playing KSP and maybe making videos about it as well. </span></p>

<p><span><strong>Ted (Ted):</strong> *</span><span>The Experimental Team and I have spent the past week testing 0.24, sorting out and reporting bugs we’ve found, making the build server sweat, and providing feedback on it. Now the QA Team and I are gearing up to test the 0.24 revisions and improvements the Developers are working hard on, while the Experimental Team get a breather between rounds. These past few months of testing are really illustrating just how important each step in the Testing Process is, and hopefully communicating why each step is so necessary to all of you.</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> Want announcements written? I’m your guy! vBulletin and the Italian subforum (open now) are two things that will be officially announced soon. I’m also looking for a few good forum moderators. If you have the skills, patience and offbeat sense of humor needed for the task, PM me on the forum.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong id="docs-internal-guid-6d24c0c1-f828-66f9-67e0-52c6bb63fcb4"><span>Rogelio (Roger): </span></strong>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been modeling the stage for the next video since last week. Im working on the uv sets and the textures for all the assets in the set so it will take a little more time to get pretty nice results and to have a better storytelling.<strong id="docs-internal-guid-6d24c0c1-f828-66f9-67e0-52c6bb63fcb4"><span> </span></strong></p>

great hear guys keep up the awesome work...

we can wait for greatness

Edit: yay i'm first

Great to hear the progress!

And for forum moderators, do you mean for the Italian forums? Either way, being a moderator seems tough, luckily we have great ones here.

From these updates, it can sometimes seem that a large chunk of Squad's man-hours is going into animations.

I trust that some of this is animation work for the game itself? Surely it's not all going into YouTube teasers...

Well, it is primarily done by Dan, and he is the animation guy...

I still miss those old gifs of kerbals taking surface samples...
The ol' list there looks a little sparse, and chance of some dropped in updates, however vague, from everyone else?

Looking forward for the 0.24...Keep up the spirit guys.

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m also looking for a few good forum moderators. If you have the skills, patience and offbeat sense of humor needed for the task, PM me on the forum.

I will personally recommend "Kasuha" for moderator. He is a kind, helpful, thoughtful and mature person. Check his reputation bar.

Thus it being the everyone was busy edition I'll see if I can get some more quotes.

Thus it being the everyone was busy edition I'll see if I can get some more quotes.

Now I'm imagining updates along the lines of

C7; Knocked on C7's door, fire came out from underneath and the hair stood up on the back of my neck, retreated to safe distance to the tune of an ominous latin chorus

Mike (Mu): Opened door to Mike's office, does not recognise my authority from cushion fort, will wait until he's had second coffee

Bob (Calisker): Voice muffled by new asbestos fireproof suit, will check again later after he's finished on the forums

Mostly because I'm bored at work

luckily we have great ones here.

Thanks!

We don't know where he's accessing the system from, only that it's somewhere in this building. Can anyone recommend a good tracking service?
